title: Figure Skater Alysa Liu Debuts Mind-Boggling Lady Gaga Routine Just Weeks Before WinterยOlympics
summary: The athlete said she "really wanted to do it once at least" ahead of the Winter Games.
body: At the 2026 United States Figure Skating Championships on Friday (Jan. 9), Alysa Liu proved once again that she’s a monster on the ice and a Little Monster in her heart. Related Watch Cynthia Erivo & Ariana Grande Help Team USA Defy Gravity in ‘Wicked’ New Winter Olympics Ads Olympic Figure Skater Alysa Liu Drops D4vd’s ‘This Is How It Feels’ From Routine ‘In Light of Recent News’ Mariah Carey Reveals She’s Performing at the 2026 Olympics Opening Ceremony: ‘Ci Vediamo a Milano!’ Despite there being just a few weeks left until the Winter Olympics in Italy, the 20-year-old skating prodigy debuted a brand new routine set to two of Lady Gaga’s best known classics: “Paparazzi” and “Bad Romance.” Taking the ice in a shimmering silver leotard, Liu dazzled the crowd and judges with a slew of unbelievable jumps, turns and spins. As Mother Monster’s voice filled up the arena, Liu let the song speak through her movements, emotion playing out on her face. She would end the competition with 228.91 points, coming in second place behind Amber Glenn. In just a few weeks, Liu wiโฆ

title: As an Android fan, thereโs only one iOS feature I want Google to copy
summary: Appleโs seamless iPhone-to-iPhone migration is the gold standard that Google still hasnโt matched for Android in 2026.
body: Android has long reached a point of maturity where it does a whole lot of things right for most of its user base. However, thereโs always room for improvement, and one area that still frustrates me as an Android user is the process of migrating to a new phone. After using the past few generations of iPhones, Iโve noticed how excellently seamless and straightforward Appleโs iPhone migration process is, and itโs one of the first things I miss when I switch back to Android flagships. Google, itโs 2026, and itโs high time you copied Appleโs simplicity in migration. Apple gets iPhone-to-iPhone transfers just right
